title: Suggestions for logo Typeface
content:
Anyone have suggestions for a better typeface. The client has approved the logo, but I think the typeface needs to be a little more friendly while still retaining a clean corporate feel.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [pdlogo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/typophile.com/files/pdlogo.gif) | 2.05 KB |

 [‹ ISBN Number, CDcover](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29289 "Go to previous forum topic") [philip glass cd booklet ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29308 "Go to next forum topic")
author: voiceof

comments.content:
\>to be a little more friendly while still retaining a clean corporate feel.

I think [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/proximanova.html) could go.
Thanks for all the suggestions, I think I’m leaning toward the Proxima sans right now. If you have any more keep ’em coming.

If you like Proxima:  
 [Futura Maxi](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&displayfontid=C.106298.0.0&fontRendererText=people+direct)  
 [Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&displayfontid=UR.109930.0.0&fontRendererText=people+direct)  
 [FF Schulbuch Nord](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=6&displayfontid=FF.2797.0.0&fontRendererText=people+direct) - grotesque in the Helv flavor, but the tailed ’l’ adds personality

And less Proxima, but still clean and casual:  
 [Freight Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=GF.118889.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=people+direct&sampleSize=48)

To go in Stephens direction somehow:  
Typ1451 from [www.lineto.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829113446/http:/www.lineto.com/ "www.lineto.com") (somebody mentioned Akkurat from lineto...).  
Check it out in the lineto typesetter. Typ1451 has a “Kabel-e” Alternate Version.

@Stephen  
Didn’t know Futura Maxi, thanks.
